intro: Pimpinella genevensis, commonly known as the Geneva cowparsley, is a rare flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Switzerland. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, often in mountainous areas. It is known for its delicate appearance and is considered a protected species due to its limited distribution. Pimpinella genevensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to alpine biodiversity.
